cnbc.title: Brent crude jumps about 5% after Trump administration sanctions big Russian oil companies
cnbc.summary: The new sanctions are related to plans for a meeting between President Donald Trump and Russian leader Vladimir Putin being dropped.

cnbc.title: Tesla reports revenue growth after two down quarters. Why the stock is falling
cnbc.summary: Tesla has returned to favor on Wall Street after a brutal start to the year.

cnbc.title: Meta lays off 600 from 'bloated' AI unit as Wang cements leadership
cnbc.summary: The cuts did not impact employees within TBD Labs, which includes many of the top-tier AI hires brought into Meta this summer, people familiar told CNBC.

cnbc.title: IBM tops third-quarter estimates and lifts guidance, but stock drops
cnbc.summary: IBM's results topped estimates and the company lifted its guidance, citing artificial intelligence tailwinds.

cnbc.title: Southwest beats earnings estimates, forecasts record revenue for current quarter
cnbc.summary: Southwest Airlines reported a surprise quarterly profit for the third quarter.

cnbc.title: Trump says U.S. cattle ranchers 'don't understand' tariffs after some slam Argentine beef plan
cnbc.summary: President Donald Trump said U.S. cattle ranchers "don't understand" how they have benefitted from his tariffs, adding that they "have to get their prices down."

cnbc.title: Government shutdown becomes 2nd longest in U.S. history
cnbc.summary: Democrats want President Donald Trump to get involved in shutdown negotiations. Senate Majority Leader John Thune says, "Open up the government first."

cnbc.title: Trump to demolish entire East Wing of White House for ballroom: 'Plans changed'
cnbc.summary: President Trump has said he and donors will cover the costs of the White House East Wing ballroom, but it is not clear who all the contributors are.

cnbc.title: AI is already taking white-collar jobs. Economists warn there's 'much more in the tank'
cnbc.summary: Across banking, the auto sector and retail, executives are warning employees and investors that AI is taking over jobs.

cnbc.title: Hundreds of public figures, including Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak and Virgin's Richard Branson urge AI ‘superintelligence’ ban
cnbc.summary: A group of prominent figures, including artificial intelligence heavyweights, has lead a call to end efforts to create ‘superintelligence.'
